title: Great Hall of Bulls at Lascaux-interpretations

content.question: Although the cave paintings in the Great Hall of the Bulls at Lascaux were originally interpreted as depictions of hunting scenes, they have more recently been interpreted as paintings intended to

choices.label: warn people about dangerous animals threatening villages
document a series of animal-based rituals
tell a mythic narrative of human origins

content.answer: document a series of animal-based rituals

topic.text: 1.3: Theories and Interpretations of Prehistoric Art

skill.text: Skill 7.A: Describe one or more art historically relevant interpretations of a work of art (or group of related works of art), its reception, or its meaning.
